CA.short_title: Financial Acctg & Ext Report'g 財務會計及對外報表

description.ENG: This course deals with advanced aspects of financial accounting. Topics covered include the financial reporting environment in Hong Kong, fair value accounting, intangible assets, contingent liabilities, deferred income taxes, accounting for post-retirement benefits, equity and cost methods of accounting for long-term investments, business combinations (purchase and pooling), consolidation of parent/subsidiary financial statements, and interpretation of financial statements. Students will be required to critically evaluate various accounting valuation, reporting and disclosure issues.
description.ZHT: 本學科有關進階的財務會計。範疇包括香港的財務報告環境﹑公允價值會計﹑無形資產﹑或有負債﹑遞延所得稅﹑退休後福利的會計﹑長期投資的權益法或成本法的會計﹑企業合併(購買及權益聯營法)﹑母公司/子公司的合併會計報表，以及財務報表的解讀。學生需要批判性地去評估各項會計估價﹑會計報告和會計披露的事宜。

info.requirement: For students in PgD Professional Accountancy; or Master of Accountancy

CA.short_title: Audit'g & Professional Pract 審計及專業執業課題

CC.short_title: Audit'g & Professional Pract 審計及專業執業課題

description.ENG: This course will provide an examination of the economic theory of auditing, the role and responsibilities of auditors, the concepts, and techniques employed by auditors, and auditing procedures for balance sheet and profit and loss items. Other topics include auditing and the public accounting profession, internal control, audit planning, financial statement audits’ reporting on auditing financial statements, professional ethics and auditor’s legal liability, accepting and planning the audit, evidential matter/working papers, internal controls, and system auditing. Other topics of current interest available in the literature will also be discussed.
description.ZHT: 本學科將深入探討審計學的經濟理論、核數師的角色和責任、以及資產負債表和損益表的審計程序。其他範疇包括審計專業的概況、內部控制、財務報表的審計報告、專業操守、核數師的法律責任、審計策劃、審計證據和核算工作底稿、內部控制，以及系統審計。本學科亦會討論其他當代審計議題。

info.requirement: For students in PgD Professional Accountancy; or Master of Accountancy

CC.short_title: Taxation and Tax Planning 稅務及稅務規劃

description.ENG: This course covers the basic elements and statutes of Hong Kong taxation system, including salaries tax, property tax, profits tax, personal assessment, depreciation allowances, and tax administration. After this basic knowledge, the course will introduce advanced concepts of tax planning, problem solving with practical examples and the inter-relationships between different types of taxes. Local tax cases will be discussed extensively.
description.ZHT: 本學科涵蓋香港稅制的基本要素和法規，包括薪俸稅﹑物業稅﹑利得稅﹑個人入息課稅﹑折舊免稅額，以及稅務管理。並介紹稅務計劃的進階概念﹑以實際事例解決稅務問題，以及各種稅項之間的關係。本地稅務個案亦會於本學科廣泛討論。

info.requirement: For students in PgD Professional Accountancy; or Master of Accountancy

CB.short_title: Financial Accounting Theory 財務會計理論

description.ENG: This course establishes a framework for evaluating accounting choices and categorizing the strength of authority for particular accounting treatments. This is accomplished by exposing the students to empirical accounting research and by creating an awareness of the endogenous factors affecting accounting decisions. Major themes are the integration of cash flow and accrual based measures of income from a theoretical perspective and the synthesis of accounting choice questions based on the asset valuation versus income measurement dichotomy. The end result will be a deeper understanding of both the structure and the process of accounting policy-making.
description.ZHT: 本學科為學員提供財務會計理論框架，以評估會計決策和分析各會計處理方法中的強弱項。學員將透過會計的實證研究了解影響會計決策的內源因素。本學科主要範疇是從理論觀點去綜合現金流量和應計為本的損益計量，並整合會計選擇中資產估值及損益計量的二元性。本學科目標是加深學生對會計決策過程和結構的了解。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy

C.short_title: Business Valuation & Analysis 企業估價與分析

description.ENG: This course introduces a framework for business valuation analysis using corporate disclosure and financial statement data. The framework identifies four key components of valuation: business strategy analysis, accounting analysis, financial analysis, and prospective analysis. Employing a case methodology, applications of this framework in a variety of decision-making contexts including securities analysis, credit analysis, and merger and acquisition decisions are examined.
description.ZHT: 本科目介紹的框架有助於我們基於公司披露的資訊和財務報表資料對公司經營業務進行分析評價。該框架指出評價的四個關鍵要素：經營戰略分析、會計分析、財務分析及前景分析。科目採用案例方法將該框架應用於諸多決策領域，其中包括證券分析、信用分析及併購決策。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy; or Executive Master of Professional Accountancy; or Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

C.short_title: Management Control Systems 管理控制系統

description.ENG: Designed properly, management control systems serve to influence and structure employee behavior in ways that increase the likelihood that organizational objectives are achieved or exceeded. This course provides an advanced-level examination of the alternative control mechanisms available to organizations, theories underlying their use, and their intended and often unintended effects on behavior. Particular attention is directed to the critical decisions underlying the design of effective accounting based control systems including choice of responsibility structure, performance measures, performance standards, and incentive systems, and to emerging issues in corporate governance.
description.ZHT: 合理設計的管理控制系統能夠影響並優化員工行為，從而有助於組織實現甚至超越自身目標。本科目是研究管理控制系統的高級教程，科目詳細考察組織中可以採用的各種控制機制，並研究這些機制背後的理論基礎以及控制機制對行為的影響，其中有些影響是可預見的，多數影響則不可預見。科目特別關注設計有效的、以會計為基礎的控制系統時面臨的關鍵決策，具體內容包括：責任結構的選擇、績效度量指標的選擇、績效標準的選擇、激勵系統的選擇。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy; or Executive Master of Professional Accountancy

CA.short_title: Assurance Svcs & Info Tech 審計服務及資訊科技

CB.short_title: Assurance Svcs & Info Tech 審計服務及資訊科技

description.ENG: This course examines Hong Kong legal environment and discusses how it will affect audit risk, audit planning, internal controls, analytical procedures, and substantive tests.   Building on this foundation, this course then focuses on information technology and examines its impacts on financial reporting systems.  Specifically, we emphasize on how auditors can leverage information technology and use Computer-Assisted Audit Tools and Techniques (CAAT) to attest clients’ financial statements.
description.ZHT: 本學科探討香港法律環境如何影響審計風險、審計計劃﹑內部控制、分析程序和實質性測試。於這些基礎上，本學科將著重資訊科技以及其對於財務報告系統的影響，並著重核數師如何透過資訊科技和計算機輔助審計技術去核實客戶的財務報表。

info.requirement:
For student in Master of Accountancy;
Prerequisite: ACCT5130

C.short_title: Legal & Regulatory Env of Bus 企業監控和法律環境

description.ENG: This course equips students with a basic understanding of how the law, public policy and the political process affect business decision making in China and abroad. In addition to introduction to business law details, it intends to provide a conceptual framework that helps students manage more effectively in a business world heavily influenced by public sector and governmental forces.
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在讓學員理解法律、公共政策及政治行為是如何影響企業的決策行為的。科目除了介紹企業的法律環境外，還為學員提供了一個理論框架，幫助他們思考在較大程度上受政府行為制約的企業環境中，如何進行更有效的企業管理。

info.requirement: For students in Executive Master of Professional Accountancy

title.ENG: Legal and Regulatory Environment of Business

CA.short_title: Taxation in China 中國稅收制度

CB.short_title: Taxation in China 中國稅收制度

description.ENG: This course is designed to familarize students with the Chinese tax law and practice. After an introduction to the normative and institutional backgrounds of tax administration, it will examine the country’s major state and local tax regimes. The course will also touch on administrative and professional aspects of tax practice in this emerging market economy.
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在讓學員認識中國的稅法和工作。科目除了介紹規範和機構的稅務行政背景，以及國家和地區的稅務管理外，亦會涉及一些關於發展中市場經濟體的行政及專業稅務實踐。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy; or Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

CA.short_title: Applied Corporate Governance 資本市場中公司治理運用實戰

description.ENG: This course equips the student with a deeper understanding of the current state of play as regards Corporate Governance principles & rules, and the institutions through which Corporate Governance rules are applied to capital market participants, with a special focus on the Hong Kong and mainland China capital markets, but also addresses the challenges and trends in the real-life market place and how the linkages between effective Enterprise Governance, Risk Management and Compliance can contribute to superior business performance and thereby to enhanced investor confidence in the capital markets.Many diverse topics which impact how Corporate Governance is applied in practice in the capital markets, such as increasing Regulatory Supervision, GRC, key Capital Market Participants, Changes in the structure of the Auditing profession, Hot business transformation trends, a new Enterprise Business Model, etc, are brought to life in an interlinking way using case studies and visiting business leaders to brief students and answer their questions.Students are encouraged throughout the course to think about practical solutions to enhance Corporate Governance practices in Hong Kong and mainland China’s capital markets.
description.ZHS: This course equips the student with a deeper understanding of the current state of play as regards Corporate Governance principles & rules, and the institutions through which Corporate Governance rules are applied to capital market participants, with a special focus on the Hong Kong and mainland China capital markets, but also addresses the challenges and trends in the real-life market place and how the linkages between effective Enterprise Governance, Risk Management and Compliance can contribute to superior business performance and thereby to enhanced investor confidence in the capital markets.Many diverse topics which impact how Corporate Governance is applied in practice in the capital markets, such as increasing Regulatory Supervision, GRC, key Capital Market Participants, Changes in the structure of the Auditing profession, Hot business transformation trends, a new Enterprise Business Model, etc, are brought to life in an interlinking way using case studies and visiting business leaders to brief students and answer their questions.Students are encouraged throughout the course to think about practical solutions to enhance Corporate Governance practices in Hong Kong and mainland China’s capital markets.
description.ZHT: 本學科為學員提供機會深入了解公司治理的原則, 規則及實踐，集中探討香港和中國內地的資本市場企業管治的經驗。同時亦強調市場的趨勢及挑戰、風險管理及合規和有效的企業管治如何影響企業的業績及投資者的信心。學科強調理論與實踐相結合, 透過個案研習及探訪商界領袖等開展互動學習, 其內容包括提升完善監管制度, 企業管治之風險管理及應用,資本市場的主要參與者及角色, 審計專業的發展狀況,  業界最新動向及企業經營模式等; 並鼓勵學員積極思考如何面對和解決香港及中國內地資本市場中所遇到公司治理的難題與挑戰。

info.requirement: For Master of Accountancy students

title.ENG: Applied Corporate Governance for Capital Markets
title.ZHS: Applied Corporate Governance for Capital Markets
title.ZHT: 資本市場中公司治理運用實戰

CA.short_title: Independent Study in Account 有關會計的獨立研究

description.ENG: Independent study gives students added flexibility to design study programmes suited to a particular area of interest or to delve more deeply into a specific topic. Students need to find a faculty member willing to serve as your supervisor, and together, devise a format. There are a wide range of possibilities under independent study. The more common alternatives are: (a) Selection of a topic not normally covered in our curriculum in which the student has an interest. Normally the student would prepare a literature review on the selected topic. It would then be common for the student to perform some application or extension of this body of knowledge by extending or substantiating that knowledge by some data collection. (b) Preparation of a case and accompanying teacher’s note. The case must be based on real organizations and substantial date collection would be expected. The student would be expected to demonstrate application of theory in preparation of the teacher’s note.
description.ZHT: 獨立研究為學生於學科選擇上提供更靈活的安排。學員可以就某方面的興趣或特定題目作深入地研究。學生需要找一位本系的認可教學人員作為導師，並共同設計研究方式。獨立研究提供不同的可能性，比較常見的方式包括：a) 選擇一個學生感興趣而現存學科並沒有涵蓋的題目。一般來說學生會準備這個特定題目的文獻探討，然後將收集資料去伸延或實證這方面的知識。b) 準備一個個案並伴有教學講義。這個個案必須基於一家真實的機構而且學生需要作資料分析。學生於準備教學講義時需要展示對理論的應用和實踐的熟識。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy

-.short_title: Categorical Survival Data Anal 分類及生存數據分析

description.ENG: This course will provide a foundation for the practical analyses of categorical and time to event (survival) data.  The course will cover the use of logistic regression models for use with binary outcomes and Cox proportional hazards regression models for time to event outcomes. Practical application of these models will be emphasized and model building and the checking of model assumptions will be covered in detail.
description.ZHS: 该课程将介绍基本的分类及生存数据分析方法。课程内容包括logistic回归模型在二分类变量上的应用和基于时间和事件的Cox比例风险模型。该课程还会详细介绍不同模型在现实生活中的应用、模型建立以及模型的假设检验。
description.ZHT: 該課程將介紹基本的分類及生存資料分析方法。課程內容包括logistic回歸模型在二分類變數上的應用和基於時間和事件的Cox比例風險模型。該課程還會詳細介紹不同模型在現實生活中的應用、模型建立以及模型的假設檢驗。

info.requirement:
For students in 
Pg Dip in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
Master of Public Health

title.ENG: Intermediate Biostatistics - Categorical Survival Data Analysis

-.short_title: Topics in Linear Models 線性模型專題

description.ENG: This course will cover advanced statistical modeling techniques for use with complex datasets. Topics will include Poisson and Negative Binomial regression for count outcomes, repeated measures ANOVA, GEE models and multilevel models for longitudinal data, multilevel models for clustered data.
description.ZHS: 该课程将介绍一些用于分析复杂数据的高级统计模型技巧。话题包括用Poisson和负二项回归模型来计算结果，以及方差分析、GEE模型、纵向数据的多层线性分析和聚类数据的多层线性分析。
description.ZHT: 該課程將介紹一些用於分析複雜資料的高級統計模型技巧。話題包括用Poisson和負二項回歸模型來計算結果，以及方差分析、GEE模型、縱向資料的多層線性分析和聚類資料的多層線性分析。

info.requirement: For students in MSc/PgD in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, MPhil in Public Health, PhD in Public Health, Master of Public Health, MSc/PgD in Health Services Management, MSc/PgD in Health Promotion and Behavioural Health

-.short_title: Topics in Multivariate Analysi 多變數分析專題

description.ENG: This course will cover methods importance in the analysis of data collected from questionnaires. Methods for translation and validation of questionnaires will be covered. Both exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis (under the framework of Structural Equation Models) will be discussed.
description.ZHS: 本课程内容包含一些重要的用于分析从调查问卷中收集的数据的方法。在结构方程模型的框架下，研讨探索性和验证性因素分析。
description.ZHT: 本課程內容包含一些重要的用於分析從調查問卷中收集的資料的方法。在結構方程模型的框架下，研討探索性和驗證性因素分析。

info.requirement: For students in MSc/PgD in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, MPhil in Public Health, PhD in Public Health, Master of Public Health, MSc/PgD in Health Services Management, MSc/PgD in Health Promotion and Behavioural Health

-.short_title: Pharmaceutical Bioinformatics 醫藥生物信息學

description.ENG: The course will provide a broad overview and introduction to bioinformatics and its applications in pharmaceutical industry. Topics will cover (1) basic bioinformatics methods: hierarchical clustering, lasso, random forest, LDA, PCA, boosting, bootstrapping, etc. (2) data sequencing and management: microarray data, GWAS data, the raw data treatment and analysis method, batch effect and normalization, parallel programming in R; (3) phylogenic analysis; (4) Chemobioinformatics modeling, 3D structure, chemical - protein relation leading to drug discovery.
description.ZHS: 该课程将会对生物信息学及其在医药工程方面的应用进行一个广泛的概述和介绍。主题包括：（1）基本的生物信息学方法：分级群聚，套索方法，随机森林，线性判别分析，主成分分析，提升算法，自助法等等。(2) 数据序列及管理：微阵列数据，全基因组关联分析数据，原始数据处理和分析方法，批处理的影响和标准化，R语言的并行程序设计；（3）系统发育分析；（4）化学生物信息学模型，3D结构，化学-蛋白的关系导致的药物发现。
description.ZHT: 該課程將會對生物資訊學及其在醫藥工程方面的應用進行一個廣泛的概述和介紹。主題包括：（1）基本的生物資訊學方法：分級群聚，套索方法，隨機森林，線性判別分析，主成分分析，提升演算法，自助法等等。(2) 資料序列及管理：微陣列資料，全基因組關聯分析資料，原始資料處理和分析方法，批次處理的影響和標準化，R語言的並行程式設計；（3）系統發育分析；（4）化學生物資訊學模型，3D結構，化學-蛋白的關係導致的藥物發現。

info.requirement:
Pre-requisites:  BIOS5001, BIOS5002 
For students in MSc/PgD in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, MPhil/PhD/PgD in Public Health, Master of Public Heath, MSc/PgD in Health Services Management, MSc/PgD in Health Promotion and Behavioural Health

-.short_title: Bio of Agin & Con of Suce Agin 生理老化及成功老化的概念及評估

description.ENG: Biology of Ageing: 1) cellular aging and theories of ageing; 2) age-related physiological changes; Successful ageing: 1) concepts and definitions; 2) existing knowledge; 3) strategies to achieve successful ageing; and 4) health promotion; Evaluation 1) Quality of life measurements : principle and tools 2) Quality of life measurements : practical application 3) Psycho-social assessment tools 4) Psycho-social assessment tools (in communications) 5) Nutrition, health and evaluation
description.ZHT: 生理老化：（１）細胞老化及老化過程理論 （２）與年齡相關的生理變化 成功的老化：（１）概念、定義及現存的知識（２）達致成功老化的策略（３）老年人之健康推廣評估：（１）生命質素的衡量：規則及工具 （２）評估(在社區、心理及老年人精神狀況的評估工具) （３）老年人的心理質素 （４）老年人的心理質素(溝通方面) （５）營養、健康及評估

title.ZHT: 生理老化及成功老化的概念及評估

-.short_title: Servic for the Older Populat'n 老年人口服務

description.ENG: Service for the older population: 1) service providers and their interaction; 2) primary, secondary and tertiary care sectors (community care, residential homes and hospitals); 3) design of living environments; 4) measuring the quality and outcomes of medical care; 5) population screening and the strategy of prevention; and 6) elderly abuse. Palliative Medicine: 1) palliation; 2) bereavement; 3) living will, assisted death and euthanasia; and 4) other ethical issues in the care of the elderly.

-.short_title: Clinical Topics 臨牀論題

description.ENG: Clinical Topics: 1) Common diseases in the elderly; 2) Common presentation of diseases; 3) Prescribing in the elderly; 4) Rehabilitation; 5) Physical training and pain relief in older persons; 6) ADL training and assistive devices in older persons; 7) Cognitive and behavioural training and 8) Psychogeriatric problems : dementia, depression and suicide in the elderly and other mental health problems.
description.ZHT: 臨牀論題：（１）老年人常見的疾病 （２）常見的老年人疾病表現形式 （３）老年人之用藥 （４）	康復 （５）老年人的體能訓練及鎮痛　（６）老年人日常活動訓練及輔助設施　（７）認知及行為訓練　（８）老年人精神問題：腦退化症、抑鬱和老人自殺 及 其他精神健康問題

info.requirement: For students in MSc or PgDip Clinical Gerontology

-.short_title: Practical Experience 臨牀實習

description.ENG: Work or attachment in the care of elderly in the medical (in the broadest sense including nursing and allied health disciplines), and/or social setting, and the writing up of one case report, consisting of three hours per week over a five-month period.

info.requirement: For students in MSc Clinical Gerontology

-.short_title: Project Report 專題研究

description.ENG: This will be carried out under the supervision of course directors, during the two year period.  Project area will be related to any of the above areas and closely related to daily work of the student.  He/She will spend a minimum of the equivalent of one contact hour per week with the supervisor.
description.ZHT: 這科目將會於兩年內在課程導師的督導下進行，學生將會每星期最少有一個小時的時間與導師會面。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Clinical Gerontology

-.short_title: Project Report 專題研究

description.ENG: This will be carried out under the supervision of course directors, during the two year period.  Project area will be related to any of the above areas and closely related to daily work of the student.  He/She will spend a minimum of the equivalent of one contact hour per week with the supervisor.
description.ZHT: 這科目將會於兩年內在課程導師的督導下進行，學生將會每星期最少有一個小時的時間與導師會面。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Clinical Gerontology

-.short_title: Clinical Seminar I 臨床心臟病研討會一

description.ENG: The seminar will be conducted in the form of problem-solving or case-based tutorial session. It will present cases employing an integrated cardiac approach which involves the use of various modalities of investigation and treatment.
description.ZHS: 本单元将以解题模式或案例教程的形式进行。这些个案将包括现时心脏疾病的各种诊断、检查及治疗的运作。
description.ZHT: 本單元將以解題模式或案例教程的形式進行。這些個案將包括現時心臟疾病的各種診斷、檢查及治療的運作。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Cardiology

-.short_title: Dissertation 專題論文

description.ENG: A 5,000-word dissertation in the form of topical review is required for graduation.
description.ZHS: 在研究生导师指导下撰写1份5,000字的专题论文。
description.ZHT: 在研究生導師指導下撰寫1份5,000字的專題論文。

E.short_title: Macroeconomics for Bus Exec 宏觀經濟分析

W.short_title: Macroeconomics for Bus Exec 宏觀經濟分析

XA.short_title: Macroeconomics for Bus Exec 宏觀經濟分析

description.ENG: This course provides students with a basic understanding of the state of the global economy and macroeconomic policy. Topics include national income accounting, unemployment, inflation, monetary and fiscal policies, and international economic interactions. Applications of economic theories to current macroeconomic phenomena will be emphasized.
description.ZHT: 這學科旨在讓同學了解全球經濟和宏觀經濟政策。學科所涵蓋的議題包括國民收入計算、失業、通貨膨脹、貨幣及財政政策，以及國際間的經濟往來。此學科着重以經濟理論解釋現今的宏觀經濟現象。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

description.ENG: The major objective of this course is to provide participants with real life examples of the application of quantitative methods, such as business statistics and operations research, to help business executives solve problems in competitive business environments.
description.ZHT: 這學科的主要目的是為學員提供應用商業統計學和運籌學研究等計量方法的真實示例，從而協助企業行政人員在競爭激烈的商業環境中解決問題。

info.requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)

description.ENG: Efficient and effective operations enable firms to gain a competitive advantage by creating cost leadership, quality superiority, and capability of meeting customer demands quickly. This course will introduce concepts, issues, tools, and techniques in designing, managing and improving business processes. Topics encompass: operations strategy, process analysis, quality management, and supply chain management, etc. Cases and business best practices will be discussed in the course to demonstrate that companies can use (and have used) the principles from this course to significantly enhance their competitiveness.
description.ZHS: 高效的营运能使企业通过成本领先、品质优势以及迅速满足顾客需求的能力来获得竞争优势。本课程将介绍设计、管理和改进业务流程中的概念、问题、工具以及技术。主题包括：营运战略、流程分析、质量管理、供应链管理等。课堂上还将讨论企业案例和最佳业务实践，以表明企业可以使用（或已使用）课程中的原则来显著提高其竞争力。
description.ZHT: 高效的營運能使企業通過成本領先、品質優勢以及迅速滿足顧客需求的能力來獲得競爭優勢。本科目將介紹設計、管理和改進業務流程中的概念、問題、工具以及技術。主題包括：營運戰略、流程分析、質量管理、供應鏈管理等。課堂上還將討論企業案例和最佳業務實踐，以表明企業可以使用（或已使用）科目中的原則來顯著提高其競爭力。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme; or EMBA

description.ENG: This course introduces the analysis of key issues related to the design and management of operations using quantitative tools such as linear, integer, and non-linear programming, regression, and statistical analysis. It covers important topics such as forecasting, aggregate planning, inventory theory, transportation, production control and scheduling, and facility location, among others, and uses mathematical modeling, spreadsheet analysis, case studies, and simulations to deliver materials.
description.ZHS: 本科通过运用量化工具（包括线性优化、整数优化、非线性优化、回归分析和统计分析等）介绍营运管理的一些关键因素。本科涵盖预测、总体计划、库存理论、运输、生产控制及计划和设施选址等内容，并使用数学建模、电子表格分析、案例讨论和仿真等教学模式。
description.ZHT: 本科通過運用量化工具（包括線性優化、整數優化、非線性優化、回歸分析和統計分析等）介紹營運管理的一些關鍵因素。本科涵蓋預測、總體計劃、庫存理論、運輸、生產控制及計劃和設施選址等內容，並使用數學建模、電子表格分析、案例討論和仿真等教學模式。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Information & Technology Management; or MSc Business Analytics

BA.short_title: Web Analytics and Intelligence 網絡分析及智能

description.ENG: The course focuses on the collection, analysis, and use of web data for business intelligence. Topics covered include web analytics concepts, web analytics technologies and techniques, visitor activity analysis methods, and web intelligence fundamentals. The course also evaluates practical, real-work analysis cases to demonstrate the strategic uses of web analytics for business intelligence and proper application of analytics techniques for online data optimization.
description.ZHS: 本课程的重点在于如何收集、分析和汇报互联网数据。主要涵盖的课题包括网络分析的概念、网络分析的工具和技术、网客活动的分析方法，以及网络智能的概念。此外，本课程亦会分析一些网络分析的案例，进而评估网络分析应如何进行才能产生商业的智能，以及网络分析的技术应如何运用才能优化在线的数据。
description.ZHT: 本學科的重點在於如何收集、分析和滙報互聯網數據。主要涵蓋的課題包括網絡分析的概念、網絡分析的工具和技術、網客活動的分析方法，以及網絡智能的概念。此外，本學科亦會分析一些網絡分析的案例，進而評估網絡分析應如何進行才能產生商業的智能，以及網絡分析的技術應如何運用才能優化在線的數據。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Information & Technology Management; or MSc Business Analytics

I.short_title: Advanced IS Practicum 資訊系統實習(進階)

description.ENG: This course bridges the gap between classroom and real world. It requires students to complete a real-world information systems project, in collaboration with a company or organization. Students are required to form a project team, under the joint supervision of a teacher and an executive of the sponsoring company.
description.ZHS: This course bridges the gap between classroom and real world. It requires students to complete a real-world information systems project, in collaboration with a company or organization. Students are required to form a project team, under the joint supervision of a teacher and an executive of the sponsoring company.
description.ZHT: 本實習課程旨在幫助學生認識現實的商業環境，並提供機會給學生，把課堂所學的理論知識應用在現實商業環境中。課程要求學生分成小組，在老師和合作公司的管理人員監督下，完成一項信息系统項目。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Info & Technology Mgt

I.short_title: Startup-From Idea to Reality 科技創業︰從理念到實踐

description.ENG: This is a practical course on entrepreneurial business management as a living skill to start, build and grow a technology enterprise. Learn by creating a new business based on the know-how and wisdom from Silicon Valley to Asia, including evaluating business opportunities, innovation, generating business model, business plan, team building, competition analysis, IP ,financing, growth, Silicon Valley and Asian business culture.
description.ZHT: 這是一門有關企業管理—開展、建立和發展技術型企業的實用課程。從學習矽谷的知識和智慧基礎上去創造新的企業，包括評估商業機會、創新、建構商業模式、商業計劃書、團隊建立、競爭分析、知識產權、融資、矽谷和亞洲的新業務商業文化。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Information & Technology Management; or MSc Business Analytics

title.ZHS: 科技创业︰从理念到实践
title.ZHT: 科技創業︰從理念到實踐

I.short_title: TQM/BPR 全面品質管理與企業流程再造

description.ENG: This course is designed to integrate the two important methodologies for business improvement, organization management and operations enhancement at the business level: total quality management (TQM) and business process re-engineering (BPR). TQM covers modern concepts, theories and practices in system design, process planning and control for quality. In addition, practices including statistical quality control, six-sigma, quality circles, quality audit and ISO-9000 series are reviewed. Applications in manufacturing, service, and non-profit settings will also be introduced. BPR covers process design concepts & methods, leverage on information technology, critical factors for implementing BPR, re-engineering roadmap, and applications in different sectors and industries. With an emphasis on real world applications, the course includes both international and local case sharing and studies to enhance learning.
description.ZHT: 本學科整合了改善機構管理及提升業務運作的兩大方案：全面優質管理（TQM）及業務流程創新（BPR）。有關全面優質管理的部分涵蓋了現今有關系統設計、流程規劃及品質控制的主要概念、理論及應用方法。本學科亦會綜述有關統計質量監控、六西格瑪、品質圈、質量審核及ISO9000系列標準的概要，以及在製造業、服務業以及社會福利機構的應用。業務流程創新的部分，會包括流程設計的概念和方法、資訊科技的應用、BPR的推行要點及路線圖，並在不同的行業的應用案例。本學科著重實戰與應用，將以本地及海外的案例作分享研習，提升學習成效。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Information & Technology Management

title.ZHS: 全面品质管理与企业流程再造
title.ZHT: 全面品質管理與企業流程再造

description.ENG: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) is an integrated information technology to manage company-wide business processes. The topics include two aspects: enterprise resource planning system and the ERP project implementation issues. This course will also introduce the evolution of ERP, concepts and application of ERP. The topics of enterprise systems will mainly brief on the core modules along the value chain such as product development, order fulfillment, production and others. Finally, the "ERP and beyond" will address how the latest developments of ERP be extended to fulfill the new demand of more enterprise initiatives.  Students will be requested to work on a group project.
description.ZHT: 企業資源規劃(ERP)是一種管理公司業務流程的綜合資訊技術。課堂內容包括兩個方面: 企業資源規劃系統和系統之落實施行。 本科目還將介紹企業資源規劃系統(ERP)的演變、概念和應用。企業系統這課題則主要沿價值鏈的核心模組，如產品開發、訂單履行、生產等作出簡介。最後，“超越ERP”將著墨於企業資源規劃(ERP)的最新發展怎樣擴大應用於更多的企業新需求上。 學員需要分組完成專案。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Information & Technology Management

-.short_title: Family Business Governance 家族企業治理

P.short_title: Family Business Governance 家族企業治理

description.ENG: This course introduces a framework to guide private and family businesses’ long-term planning. In the course, students seek to understand how entrepreneurs and their family members provide unique assets and contributions leading to the success of the firms, and how various roadblocks challenge the sustainability of the family firm model. It can be realized that the family assets and roadblocks are similar across firms, countries and cultures, and therefore a general framework can be applied to address critical governance decisions including family governance, ownership structures, executive compensation and promotion, and succession and exit, with the aim of improving the well-being of both the firms and the families behind them.
description.ZHS: This course introduces a framework to guide private and family businesses’ long-term planning. In the course, students seek to understand how entrepreneurs and their family members provide unique assets and contributions leading to the success of the firms, and how various roadblocks challenge the sustainability of the family firm model. It can be realized that the family assets and roadblocks are similar across firms, countries and cultures, and therefore a general framework can be applied to address critical governance decisions including family governance, ownership structures, executive compensation and promotion, and succession and exit, with the aim of improving the well-being of both the firms and the families behind them.
description.ZHT: 本學科預測家族與企業傳承模式，介紹配套制度，研究的問題包括如何發掘家族經營事業的特殊優勢，如何傳承家族理念等無形資産，如何設計與分配家族股權，如何設置執行整合家族意見的家族治理機制，如何培養事業接班人，如何激勵專業經理人，等等。本學科將爲分析上述問題提供理論架構，通過講座、案例分析以及對當代研究和公共觀點的討論，介紹重要的公司與家族治理問題及其解决方案。

info.requirement: For students in EMBA (Chinese)

P.short_title: Sem on Bus & Magt Issues 工商管理問題研討

description.ENG: This course addresses the latest development in the fields of business and management. Some relevant topics such as electronic business, leadership, corporate governance, social and cultural issues, entrepreneurship, start-ups and IPOs, cross cultural business management, etc. would be incorporated in this seminar course.
description.ZHT: 本科目關注工商管理領域的最新發展，涵蓋的議題包括電子商務、領導才能、企業管治、社會和文化議題、企業家精神、創業和首次公開募股、跨文化企業管理等。

info.requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)

title.ENG: Seminar on Business and Management Issues

AE.short_title: Selected Topics in Bus & Magt 商業與管理專題討論

description.ENG: This course aims to expose our participants to a wide spectrum of global, regional and local business and management issues.  To facilitate effective learning, specific topics will be selected for incorporating in this course: examples include trade, economics, technology, finance, market, ventures, politics, corporate governance, management practices, as well as various societal concerns.  Throughout this course, lectures, talks, and site visits, in the local and/or international arena, will be conducted to enable participants to identify in-depth the gist behind certain selected management and business topics and to come up with insights to help corporations make better decisions in the future. This course consists of an introductory review, followed by an intensive study week in the local and/or international arena. Participants have to report their learning and insights with other students after the study week.
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在讓學生了解廣泛的環球、地區和本地工商管理議題。為強化學習，本科目特別選取了一系列議題，包括貿易、經濟、科技、金融、市場、創投、政治、企業管治、管理實務以及各種社會議題。學生將在本地和/或國際場合參加講座、演講和實地考察，深入了解科目涉及的工商管理基本概念，並就改善企業未來決策提出建言。內容包括課程簡介，以及隨後開展的本地和/或國際範圍內的深入研究周。學生在研究周後將與其他同學合作，報告學習心得。

description.ENG: The course will include a series of tutorials for appraising the methods of commonly used epidemiological study designs. In each tutorial, a published study of a specific design (e.g., randomized controlled trial) will be selected and presented and questions regarding the methods of the study will be asked. Students need to carefully read and discuss the questions beforehand and further discuss with the tutor and peers in the class.
description.ZHT: 課程將包括一系列的教程介紹常用流行病學研究設計方法的評價。在每個教程裏，老師將選擇並介紹使用一個具體研究設計(如隨機對照臨床試驗)並且已經發表的研究，詢問學生有關該研究方法學的問題。學生需要事先閱讀已發表的研究，討論有關研究方法的問題，並在課程中與老師和同學進一步討論。

info.requirement: For students in MSc/PgD in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, MPhil in Public Health, PhD in Public Health, Master of Public Health, PgD in Public Health, MSc/PgD in Health Services Management, MSc/PgD in Health Promotion and Behavioural Health

title.ENG: Appraisal of the Methods of Epidemiological Studies
title.ZHT: 流行病學研究的方法學評價

-.short_title: Selected Topic in Epidemiology 流行病學專題

description.ENG: The course involves a series of guest lecture seminars in which methodological aspects of various areas of epidemiological research are discussed and elaborated
description.ZHS: The course involves a series of guest lecture seminars in which methodological aspects of various areas of epidemiological research are discussed and elaborated
description.ZHT: The course involves a series of guest lecture seminars in which methodological aspects of various areas of epidemiological research are discussed and elaborated

-.short_title: Nutritional Epidemiology 營養流行病學

description.ENG: In this course, you will learn about the methods used to assess dietary intakes and how to overcome limitations in assessing such a complex ‘exposure’. Nutrient intakes and dietary patterns in different population groups will be illustrated and key diet-disease associations will be presented. Finally, some of the challenges in interpreting nutritional epidemiology evidence and practical issues in communicating findings will be covered.
description.ZHS: In this course, you will learn about the methods used to assess dietary intakes and how to overcome limitations in assessing such a complex ‘exposure’. Nutrient intakes and dietary patterns in different population groups will be illustrated and key diet-disease associations will be presented. Finally, some of the challenges in interpreting nutritional epidemiology evidence and practical issues in communicating findings will be covered.
description.ZHT: 本課程介紹營養流行病學研究方法以及如何理解相關領域研究證據。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

-.short_title: Practice in Systematic Review 系統綜述和薈萃分析實踐

description.ENG: This course is an advanced module for students who are interested in conducting systematic review and meta-analysis. It emphasizes on practical knowledge and skills needed for doing this kind of research: performing exhaustive literature search to identify relevant studies, extracting data from eligible studies, assessing risk of bias, synthesizing data, including meta-analysis, presenting results graphically and tabularly, investigating heterogeneity and potential biases, and publishing manuscripts in peer-reviewed journals. Tutorial materials will be distributed to students for their in-class exercises. Students will be enabled to master the essential skills for doing systematic review and meta-analysis by the end of this module.
description.ZHS: 本课程旨在教授系统综述和荟萃分析的实用方法与技能。
description.ZHT: 本課程旨在教授系統綜述和薈萃分析的實用方法與技能。

info.requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

title.ENG: Practice in Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
title.ZHS: 系统综述和荟萃分析实践
title.ZHT: 系統綜述和薈萃分析實踐

W.short_title: Invest Anal & Portfo Managt 投資分析與組合管理

description.ENG: The purpose of this course is to provide a comprehensive introduction to fundamental analysis of securities. The materials covered will help students to become familiar with a variety of financial instruments traded in the equity and fixed-income markets, to understand the theoretical foundation for, and practical implementation of, widely used asset pricing theories, and to develop essential skills needed to succeed as an investment professional.
description.ZHT: 本學科旨在全面介紹證券的基本分析。透過學科教材，同學將對在股權和固定收益市場交易的金融工具更熟悉，並了解資產定價理論的學說基礎和實際執行，從而建立成為專業投資從業員的必須條件。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

W.short_title: Corp Fund-Rais in Chi Equ Mkt 中國企業股票市場融資

description.ENG: This course delves into the major issues surrounding equity fund-raising in China. The principal focus is on initial public offerings (IPOs) and seasoned issues in Chinese stocks (including H- share, ‘red-chip’, private Chinese and ‘China-concept’ issuers) listed in Hong Kong. The characteristics of the various corporate entities and the nature of the funding methods utilized are critically explored. Case analysis of major IPO and seasoned equity issues (rights issues and private placings) features to amplify these objectives. Shanghai A- share listings are also considered as well as the various reforms to its constituent issuers. These include the transformation of non-tradable stock holdings into tradable form, the development of QFII and QDII schemes and the key reforms to China’s leading state-owned commercial banks. Finally, dual listings, such as American depositary receipts, and alternative routes to listing (‘reverse takeovers’) are also assessed. Upon completion of the course, students will have developed key insights into a major global funding activity.
description.ZHT: 本學科主要討論中國企業股票巿場融資。討論的重點包括中國股票在香港股票市場首次公開招股及現金增資股票的個案分析，包括H股、紅籌股、民企及中國概念股。本學科將會通過案例分析探究以上企業融資的特質。上海A股市場的上巿形式也會討論，當中包括如何將不能轉換股份轉換成可轉換股份，QFII及QDII的發展，中國主要國有銀行的關鍵改革等。借殼上巿，如美國存託憑證和不同上巿方法（如反收購）也會在學科最後研究。完成本學科時，學生應該對全球集資活動的關鍵有所理解。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA, MBA (Evening Mode), MBA (Weekend Mode), JD/MBA Double Degree & MSc Finance

title.ENG: Corporate Fund-Raising Initiatives in the Chinese Equity Markets
title.ZHS: 中国企业股票市场融资
title.ZHT: 中國企業股票市場融資

description.ENG: The objective of this course is to examine the problems and procedures of investment management, types of investment risks, and investment problems of the individual as well as the corporation. The performance and behaviour of the following financial assets are investigated: stocks, bonds, foreign exchange, financial futures, options, and warrants. The floating interest rate, the interest rate swap, and the currency swap are also examined.
description.ZHT: 此科目的目的是檢驗金融投資管理的問題和程序、投資風險的類型以及個人和企業的投資問題。將探討下列金融資產的業績和行為：股票、債券、外匯、金融期貨/期權和權證等。同時，亦會探討浮動利率，利率交換，外匯信貸等。

info.requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)

CA.short_title: Fin Markets & Instruments 金融市場與工具

CB.short_title: Fin Markets & Instruments 金融市場與工具

description.ENG: Financial markets play a pivotal and central role in the formation of investment capital and, therefore, societal wealth. This function, in addition to many others, is explored in this course. Attention will also focus on the forms and structures of financial markets (i.e., stock, futures, gold and foreign exchange markets) both locally and internationally. Within this brief, detailed consideration is also given to the various institutions participating in the markets and to the form and functions of instruments quoted.
description.ZHT: 金融市場在籌集投資資本過程中起著至關重要的作用，從而對社會財富的形成也會產生重要影響。本科目研究金融市場的這一功能，同時也研究其他諸多功能。科目重點關注國際、國內金融市場的特徵和結構（如股票、債券、衍生品、黃金市場及外匯市場）。同時，詳細論述金融市場上的各種參與主體以及金融工具的功能和特徵。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA; or Master of Accountancy; or Executive Master of Professional Accountancy

E.short_title: Fixed-Income Securities Analy 固定收入証券分析

description.ENG: The focus of this course is on the valuation of fixed-income securities and investment techniques in managing fixed income portfolios. Topics include the term structures of interest rates and forward rates; bond pricing, interest rate and reinvestment risks; risk and hedging in bond portfolio management; duration, convexity and portfolio immunization; corporate bonds, emerging-market bonds and default risks; fixed-income securities with embedded options; callable and convertible bonds, mortgage-backed securities; interest rate derivatives; and interest rate futures, swaps, caps and floors.
description.ZHT: 本學科主要集中在固定收入證券的評估和在管理固定收入投資組合中的投資技巧。包括利率期限結構和遠期匯率債券定價利率、再投資風險、債券投資組合管理風險及其對沖方法、久期凸性及資產組合免疫企業債券、新興市場債券及其信貸風險、有嵌入式期權的固定收入證券、可贖回和可轉換債券、住房抵押貸款證券化、利率衍生產品、利率期貨合約、掉期合約、利率上下限期權。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Finance; or Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

description.ENG: This course integrates areas within financial management and investments to analyse merger and acquisition (takeover) markets. The class will be conducted using both lectures and presentations. The topics covered in lectures include an overview of takeover markets, legal aspects and restrictions, capital budgeting techniques, the efficient market hypothesis, the market model and computation of abnormal returns, the dividend discount model and the free cash flow model. The topics covered in presentations will include US and Hong Kong cases of mergers, tender offers and leveraged buyouts. Amongst other things, the efficient market hypothesis is applied to analyse the stock market response to takeover announcement as well as a range of other issues including: welfare gains/losses associated with takeover, the cost of capital for due acquiror and the intrinsic value of the target (using dividend discount and free cashflow models).
description.ZHT: 本學科綜合了財務管理和投資的範疇去分析合併和收購市場。課堂會採用授課及演講的形式。課題包括併購市場的概覽、法律觀點及條例、資本預算方法、有效市場假說、其市場模型和異常回報的計算、股息貼現模型以及自由現金流模型。演講主題包括在美國和香港合併、投標報價和槓桿收購中的案例，除此之外，有效市場假說將會被應用在股票市場對併購公告的反應以及其他問題，例如因併購產生的福利獲得或損失，收購者的資金成本及其目標的內在價值（使用股息貼現和自由現金流模型。）

info.requirement: For students in MSc Finance; or Full-time MBA; or MBA (Evening Mode); or MBA (Weekend Mode); or JD/MBA Double Degree Programme

description.ENG: The objective of this course is to integrate various subfields of finance for the formulation of financial policies. The focus is on the application of financial theory to real-world business decisions, financing and restructuring strategies. The course also emphasizes the impact of institutional constraints on managers' financial decision-making and the implementation of financial strategies.
description.ZHT: 本學科的主旨是綜合不同財務學的範疇去組成金融政策。其焦點在於金融理論在現實商業政策中和融資及重組策略中的應用。本學科也強調機構（制度）約束對管理者在投資決定及實施財務策略時的影響。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Finance

FA.short_title: Venture Capit & Private Equity 創業投資與私募投資

description.ENG: The course will outline the mechanisms of venture capital (VC) investment and the financing of startups and early growth firms. As VC is a subset of private equity, the course will discuss the management, legal and marketing issues of private equity in general. Topics include raising and structuring private equity funds, the limited partnership, and fund strategies. The course will consider the investment decision of institutional investors in private equity and how funds are structured to meet their needs. It will discuss post-subscription private equity fund management - deal screening, evaluation, negotiation, disbursement, investee management, valuation and exit - and will consider specifically the perspective of the VC investee company - alternative sources of financing, how to approach a VC to maximize chances of success, and governance issues in VC financed firms. The course may also delve into public versus private equity buyouts, valuation of buyouts and corporate restructuring under private equity.
description.ZHT: 本學科會概述創業投資和新興企業融資的機制。由於創業投資是私募投資的一部份，本學科會就私募投資在管理、法律及巿場上的不同方面作出討論。主題包括如何籌集和組織私募融資有限合夥及基金投資策略、機構投資者投資私募投資決策及基金如何滿足投資者需要等。本學科也會討論私募投資基金的監督管理，包括投資案的篩選、評估、協商支出、被投資公司的管理、估值及退出等不同方面，和如何從被投資公司的角度考慮其他資金的來源、如何提高募集私募投資的成功機率和在投資後的企業管治問題。同時，也會在教學中探究上巿和非上市的併購基金，併購價格評估及在私募投資下的企業重組。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA, MBA (Evening Mode), MBA (Weekend Mode), JD/MBA Double Degree & MSc Finance

FB.short_title: Fundamen of Dervia Trad Strate 衍生商品交易策略基礎

description.ENG: This course intends to offer students insight into the implementation of options theory in the practical trading environment.  The main strategies for trading derivatives will be discussed and the students are to apply their knowledge in practical trading sessions.
description.ZHT: 本學科主要讓學生理解現實交易環境中期權理論的應用。當中討論衍生工具交易中的策略以及如何在實際操作中靈活應用已學的知識。

info.requirement: For students in Full-time MBA, MBA (Evening Mode), MBA (Weekend Mode), JD/MBA Double Degree & MSc Finance

title.ZHS: 衍生商品交易策略基础
title.ZHT: 衍生商品交易策略基礎

FA.short_title: Economics for Finance Practice 金融實務經濟學

FB.short_title: Economics for Finance Practice 金融實務經濟學

FC.short_title: Economics for Finance Practice 金融實務經濟學

description.ENG: The course covers both micro- and macro-economics fundamental to finance practice. Topics for microeconomics include: game theory and its application in finance, asymmetric information, consumer and producer behaviors, externality, public goods, information technology and network effect, asset markets and investment under uncertainty, mean variance optimization and portfolio theory, and behavioral economics. Topics for macroeconomics include: Classical macroeconomics, Keynesian macroeconomics, Output, inflation and unemployment, trade and exchange rate, economic policies, and Economic growth.
description.ZHS: The course covers both micro- and macro-economics fundamental to finance practice. Topics for microeconomics include: game theory and its application in finance, asymmetric information, consumer and producer behaviors, externality, public goods, information technology and network effect, asset markets and investment under uncertainty, mean variance optimization and portfolio theory, and behavioral economics. Topics for macroeconomics include: Classical macroeconomics, Keynesian macroeconomics, Output, inflation and unemployment, trade and exchange rate, economic policies, and Economic growth.
description.ZHT: 本學科涵蓋和金融相關的微觀及宏觀經濟學。微觀經濟課題包括博弈論及其在金融財務中的應用、資訊不對稱、消費者及製造者的行為模式、外部效應、公用物品、資訊科技及網絡效應、在不確定中的資產巿場及投資、均值方差最佳化及投資組合理論及行為經濟學。宏觀經濟課題包括古典宏觀經濟、凱恩斯主義經濟學、產量、通脹及失業、貿易及匯率和經濟政策及増長。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Finance

FA.short_title: Cred Risk & Cred as Asset Clas 信貸風險分析研究

description.ENG: This elective course aims to teach the fundamental concepts underlying general and advanced analytical tools in credit risk modelling, credit rating methodology, counterparty credit risk and credit derivatives.  Course contents will also relate to latest market regulations and capital requirements.
description.ZHS: This elective course aims to teach the fundamental concepts underlying general and advanced analytical tools in credit risk modelling, credit rating methodology, counterparty credit risk and credit derivatives.  Course contents will also relate to latest market regulations and capital requirements.
description.ZHT: 本學科旨在教授信貸風險模型，信貸評級方法，交易對方信貸風險及信貸衍生工具中基本及高級分析工具的基本概念。學科內容將涉及最新的巿場規管條例及資本充足比率。

info.requirement: For students in MSc Finance

title.ENG: Credit Risk & Credit as an Asset Class

B.short_title: Foundations of Financial Econ 金融學原理

description.ENG: This course intends to build a solid foundation of modern finance. It covers individual investment decisions under uncertainty, mean-variance portfolio theory, theory of capital market equilibrium, dynamic asset pricing. The principle of no arbitrage and its application will be emphasized throughout the course.
description.ZHS: 本科目旨在介绍现代财务学基础理论。 讲解包括不确定性下的个人投资决定、投资组合理论、资本市场均衡理论、动态资本价格分析与无套利均衡理论等。 另外，本科目亦注重财务学实践的分析。
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在介紹現代財務學基礎理論。 講解包括不確定性下的個人投資決定、投資組合理論、資本市場均衡理論、動態資本價格分析與無套利均衡理論等。 另外，本科目亦注重財務學實踐的分析。

info.requirement: For students in MBA Finance

description.ENG: This course discusses the financial management decisions of a corporation in depth. Specific topics include capital budgeting analysis under perfect and non-perfect competitive setups; theories of agency costs and asymmetric information that underlie financial decisions; capital structure; dividend policy; raising equity capital and long-term debt; warrants and convertibles; and corporate risk management.
description.ZHS: 本科目向学生提供对公司投资及融资决策较深入的探讨。内容包括资本预算、代理成本及非对称信息理论、资本结构、股息政策、股票及债券融资、认股权证及可换股债券、公司风险管理等等。
description.ZHT: 本科目向學生提供對公司投資及融資决策較深入的探討。內容包括資本預算、代理成本及非對稱信息理論、資本結構、股息政策、股票及債券融資、認股權証及可換股債券、公司風險管理等等。

info.requirement: For students in MBA Finance; or Executive Master of Professional Accountancy

A.short_title: Commercial Banking 商業銀行管理

description.ENG: This course is designed to examine and analyse bank's major functions and the principles underlying modern banking operations and practices. It covers issues including bank's payment operations and their roles, the general principles of bank lending, the range of credit services available and the principles of taking securities, trade finance, credit cards and some other major banking services. Various bank risk management methods are conducted in a simulated environment.
description.ZHS: 本科目旨在探讨商业银行之主要功能及运作原理。课题包括银行交收系统及其作用、借贷服务、证券交收、贸易融资、信用卡及其他银行服务、银行风险管理等等。
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在探討商業銀行之主要功能及運作原理。課題包括銀行交收系統及其作用、借貸服務、証券交收、貿易融資、信用卡及其他銀行服務、銀行風險管理等等。

info.requirement: For students in MBA Finance

A.short_title: China Economics & Finance 中國經濟與金融

description.ENG: The purpose of this course is to help students study and understand economic and financial policies of china, with a focus on macroeconomic issues.  The history and current issues of the China financial markets and institutions are addressed.
description.ZHS: 本课程从宏观角度学习和了解中国经济政策与金融体系。中国金融体系的历史及热点问题是本课程讨论的重点
description.ZHT: 本科目從宏觀角度學習和瞭解中國經濟政策與金融體系。中國金融體系的歷史及熱點問題是本科目討論的重點。

info.requirement: For students in MBA Finance

description.ENG: Entrepreneurial Finance is a course that examines the issues confronting entrepreneurial firms at all stages of their evolution. The course emphasizes the framework and skills needed to identify business ideas, valuation tools of new ventures; raising and structuring financing, including venture capital, angel financing, venture leasing, bank financing, government financing, and ultimately cashing out by IPO and acquisition processes.
description.ZHS: 本课程探讨企业在其不同成长阶段中的相关问题。重点探讨用以识别企业理念的一般原理及方法 ; 对新兴企业的评估手段 ; 筹资及融资安排 , 包括风险资本、赞助融资、风险租赁、银行融资、政府融资及项目获利 , 公开上市及收购等方式。
description.ZHT: 本科目探討企業在其不同成長階段中的相關問題。重點探討用以識別企業理念的一般原理及方法 ; 對新興企業的評估手段 ; 籌資及融資安排 , 包括風險資本、贊助融資、風險租賃、銀行融資、政府融資及項目獲利 , 公開上市及收購等方式。

info.requirement: For students in MBA Finance

B.short_title: Derivatives Mkt & Fin Engg 衍生品市場及金融工程

description.ENG: This course examines the valuation and market structure of derivative securities. Topics include the role of derivative securities, the determination of forward and futures prices, hedging strategies using futures, trading strategies with futures, properties of options, the pricing of stock options, options on indices, currencies and futures contracts, risk analysis, applications of option pricing models, biases in the Black-Scholes model, interest rate options, exotic options, risk management with options, and trading strategies with options. The course demonstrates the ways in which financial innovations profoundly affect the alternatives available to corporations, investment managers, and financial intermediaries.  While some technical aspects of financial engineering are going to be covered many cases are chosen to bridge the gaps between theories and practices.  Students are encouraged to use Excel, VBA or other computational tools to build and analyze models.
description.ZHS: This course examines the valuation and market structure of derivative securities. Topics include the role of derivative securities, the determination of forward and futures prices, hedging strategies using futures, trading strategies with futures, properties of options, the pricing of stock options, options on indices, currencies and futures contracts, risk analysis, applications of option pricing models, biases in the Black-Scholes model, interest rate options, exotic options, risk management with options, and trading strategies with options. The course demonstrates the ways in which financial innovations profoundly affect the alternatives available to corporations, investment managers, and financial intermediaries.  While some technical aspects of financial engineering are going to be covered many cases are chosen to bridge the gaps between theories and practices.  Students are encouraged to use Excel, VBA or other computational tools to build and analyze models.
description.ZHT: 本科目探討衍生證券的估值和市場結構。探討主題包括衍生證券的角色、遠期和期貨價格的測算、利用期貨套期保值策略、期貨的交易策略、期權性質、股票期權的定價、期權指數，外匯和期貨合約，風險分析，策略期權定價模型的應用，布萊克—斯克爾斯期權定價模型的偏差、利率期權、奇異期權、期權與風險管理與期權交易策略。科目將說明金融創新深刻影響企業、投資經理以及金融仲介機構可選擇的備選方案的不同方式。在很多情況下，金融工程的一些技術方面將會被廣泛涉及，並會被選擇作為理解理論與實踐之間的橋樑。該科目鼓勵學生使用Excel，VBA或其他計算工具來構建和分析模型。

FA.short_title: Law & Securities Mkts 法律和證券市場

description.ENG: This course is designed to introduce students already familiar with the economics of securities markets to the law that governs those markets and the transactions in securities they are designed to execute. The course will closely examine actual legal documentation to show its basic structure and purpose. Further, the course will analyze basic legal principles that shape the law and regulation of corporate finance and securities markets, such as legal strategies to overcome asymmetric information, moral hazard and agency problems, as well as techniques to secure prior claims against assets held in the possession of another entity in any bankruptcy proceedings regarding that entity.
description.ZHS: This course is designed to introduce students already familiar with the economics of securities markets to the law that governs those markets and the transactions in securities they are designed to execute. The course will closely examine actual legal documentation to show its basic structure and purpose. Further, the course will analyze basic legal principles that shape the law and regulation of corporate finance and securities markets, such as legal strategies to overcome asymmetric information, moral hazard and agency problems, as well as techniques to secure prior claims against assets held in the possession of another entity in any bankruptcy proceedings regarding that entity.
description.ZHT: 本學科旨在為已經熟悉證券市場經濟運作的學生介紹相關的市場和交易規管法律。本學科會通過考量實務運用中的相關法律文檔去顯示其基本結構及作用，而且，分析各種影響企業融資和證券市場法律的基本法律原理，例如針對資訊不對稱、道德風險和代理成本問題的法律策略，以及保障在破產程式中相關財產權利的技巧。

description.ENG: The course introduces mathematical modeling concepts and techniques for financial applications. The classic Black-Scholes Model, local volatility, stochastic volatility are critically evaluated. Interest rate models such as Ho-Lee, Hull-White, Heath-Jarrow-Morton (HJM), Libor Market Model are discussed.  Cross currency models for foreign exchanges and modeling for commodity are also covered.
description.ZHS: The course introduces mathematical modeling concepts and techniques for financial applications. -.short_title: Intro to Comparative Politics 比較政治學導論

description.ENG: This course introduces the concept of Comparative Politics to students, examining the actions, attitudes and policies of states by comparing and contrasting them with their counterparts. The course will focus the actions of the Great Powers in Central and Southeast Asia, and the Middle East, drawing upon current events as references.
description.ZHS: This course introduces the concept of Comparative Politics to students, examining the actions, attitudes and policies of states by comparing and contrasting them with their counterparts. The course will focus the actions of the Great Powers in Central and Southeast Asia, and the Middle East, drawing upon current events as references.
description.ZHT: 本科介紹比較政治學，通過比較不同大國在中亞、東南亞及中東等地的行動，態度及政策來認識國與國之間的互動關係，並參考現實例子。

info.requirement: For Students of MSSc in Global Political Economy only

-.short_title: Economics of Global Energy 全球能源市場經濟學

description.ENG: The course investigates the global politics that surrounds the dependency of human societies and economies on natural environments, and the resources and ecological services they provide. As human populations have quadrupled in the past century, and continue to grow, state and international structures and institutions are playing catch-up with emergent environmental pressures & conflicts. Human-induced scarcity and challenges, such as natural resource depletion and climate change, create economic and political pressures on both state, regional and transnational levels. In this course we examine these pressures and the related conflicts, negotiations, agreements and disagreements.
description.ZHS: The course investigates the global politics that surrounds the dependency of human societies and economies on natural environments, and the resources and ecological services they provide. As human populations have quadrupled in the past century, and continue to grow, state and international structures and institutions are playing catch-up with emergent environmental pressures & conflicts. Human-induced scarcity and challenges, such as natural resource depletion and climate change, create economic and political pressures on both state, regional and transnational levels. In this course we examine these pressures and the related conflicts, negotiations, agreements and disagreements.
description.ZHT: 本科研究圍繞人文社會和經濟對自然環境的依賴以及人文社會為提供資源與生態服務所構成的全球政治。隨著全球人口在過去一世紀增長了四倍並將持續膨脹，國家和國際組織正著手解決新興的環境壓力與衝突。人為促成的稀少性和挑戰如天然資源的損耗與全球氣候改變都為國家、地區以至跨國家層面帶來經濟與政治的壓力。本課程亦將探討這些壓力與相關的衝突、談判、協議與爭論。

title.ZHS: The Economics of Global Energy Markets

-.short_title: Strategic Aspects in IR 戰略研究

description.ENG: This course deals with the topic of strategy in the 21st century, focusing on the evolution of new technology and modes of warfare, and their implications for International relations, peacekeeping and the threats to the Global stability.
description.ZHS: 本科涉猎二十一世纪的军事战略议题，著眼於科技与作战模式的演变及其对国际关係、维护和平和全球稳定的影响和威胁。
description.ZHT: 本科涉獵二十一世紀的軍事戰略議題，著眼於科技與作戰模式的演變及其對國際關係、維護和平和全球穩定的影響和威脅。

description.ENG: This course introduces to the student the concept of social entrepreneurship within the framework of International Political Economy, aiming to examine the development of such in the post World War II era, and analyzing its effectiveness in solving various issues such as poverty and migration.
description.ZHS: This course introduces to the student the concept of social entrepreneurship within the framework of International Political Economy, aiming to examine the development of such in the post World War II era, and analyzing its effectiveness in solving various issues such as poverty and migration.
description.ZHT: 本科以全球政治經濟學的框架介紹社會企業家精神的概念並旨在探討二戰後其發展過程，藉此分析其在解決國際及社會問題如貧窮及移民等的有效性。

description.ENG: This course will examine the topic of ethnicity and national identity, demographic models of both developed and developing countries and their relationship to migration, as well as their effects on the International Political Economy of nations and the root causes behind them.
description.ZHS: This course will examine the topic of ethnicity and national identity, demographic models of both developed and developing countries and their relationship to migration, as well as their effects on the International Political Economy of nations and the root causes behind them.
description.ZHT: 本科探討種族和民族認同的議題，並研究已發展國家和發展中國家的人口分佈模式與遷移的互動關係、背後原因及對國際政治經濟的影響 。

-.short_title: Creative Industry in the World 創意產業

description.ENG: The course examines the nature, concepts, and characteristics of creative industries, such as film, advertising, Internet, art, broadcasting media etc., from different regions in the world. It will cover both theoretical and practical perspectives in understanding the industry and deal with topics like the production, consumption, market, management and other important issues in the creative industry.
description.ZHS: 本科会探讨各种创意媒体如手工艺, 电影, 绘画等对全球政治经济的影响, 并运用由冷战时期起至现今的例子, 分析创意产业的演变过程及其与不同国家政权的互动影响.
description.ZHT: 本科會探討各種創意媒體如手工藝, 電影, 繪畫等對全球政治經濟的影響, 並運用由冷戰時期起至現今的例子, 分析創意產業的演變過程及其與不同國家政權的互動影響.

-.short_title: Pan Pearl River Integration 泛珠三角一體化

description.ENG: This course focuses on the Pearl River Delta Region, following current developments in the area and examining its place in the political economy of China, as well as its significance towards the economy and society of its neighboring provinces.
description.ZHS: This course focuses on the Pearl River Delta Region, following current developments in the area and examining its place in the political economy of China, as well as its significance towards the economy and society of its neighboring provinces.
description.ZHT: 本科的研究重點在珠江三角洲地區的發展，其在中國政治經濟方面的地位及對周邊省份的經濟和社會的顯著影響。

info.requirement: For Students of MSSc in Global Political Economy only

-.short_title: Cross-Strait Political Economy 兩岸政治經濟

description.ENG: This course examines the political economic relationship between Taiwan and China, with a focus on Taiwan’s economic policy towards China.  This course traces the history of cross-Strait relations since World War II and Taiwan’s recent democratization, and analyzes the controversies over Taiwan’s liberalization of its trade and investment relations with the Chinese economy, particularly in relations to national identity.  The course will also introduce select theories of international political economy.
description.ZHS: This course examines the political economic relationship between Taiwan and China, with a focus on Taiwan’s economic policy towards China.  This course traces the history of cross-Strait relations since World War II and Taiwan’s recent democratization, and analyzes the controversies over Taiwan’s liberalization of its trade and investment relations with the Chinese economy, particularly in relations to national identity.  The course will also introduce select theories of international political economy.
description.ZHT: 本科旨在探討台灣與中國之間的政治經濟，集中分析台灣對中國的經濟政策。本科將追溯自二次大戰及台灣民主化起的兩岸關係史；並分析台灣對中國開放其貿易和投資項目所引起之爭議，尤其在民族認同上的議題。本科亦會挑選某些有關國際政治經濟的理論作介紹。

info.requirement: For Students of MSSc in Global Political Economy only

-.short_title: Doing Business in China 全球政治經濟下的中國營商環境

description.ENG: The course will study the business environment in China, focusing on policy and regulatory changes as well as the need for economic restructuring within the rapidly changing global economy. Students will learn from guest lecturers who are experts in their respective fields (such as law and tax) as well as engage in negotiating a simulated business deal designed to let students experience the real world environment.
description.ZHS: 本科会分析中国的营商环境，并集中讨论政策和监管上的转变，以及在瞬息万变的全球经济情况下对经济转型的需求。学生不但能够从客席讲师学到其专业范畴的相关知识 (例如法律及税务)，更可参与模拟现实环境的商业谈判个案。
description.ZHT: 本科會分析中國的營商環境，並集中討論政策和監管上的轉變，以及在瞬息萬變的全球經濟情況下對經濟轉型的需求。學生不但能夠從客席講師學到其專業範疇的相關知識 (例如法律及稅務)，更可參與模擬現實環境的商業談判個案。
